docs.snippet: Consumers, states and other countries demand cleaner cars. Weaker federal rules will fracture the car market.

headline.print_headline: Gas Guzzlers Hurt the Auto Industry
headline.main: Looser Emissions Standards Will Hurt the Auto Industry

docs.snippet: Two analyses show that despite the president’s claim of outclassing competitors, older Trump-branded buildings in New York are worth less than newer builds.

headline.print_headline: Trump’s Towers Pale in Comparison With Nearby Ultraluxury Buildings, Reports Say
headline.main: Trump’s Towers Pale Next to Ultraluxury Buildings, Studies Show

docs.snippet: With Britain’s most prestigious literary award increasingly dominated by Americans, a push to return to old rules excluding them has gained strength.

headline.print_headline: British Authors Urge Ban Of U.S. Titles for Honor
headline.main: Bar Americans From Man Booker Prize, Fed-Up British Authors Urge

docs.snippet: The American Civil Liberties Union condemned the Trump administration’s plan, saying it risked chilling freedom of speech and association.

headline.print_headline: 14 Million Visitors a Year Could Face Social-Media Screening by the U.S.
headline.main: 14 Million Visitors to U.S. Face Social Media Screening

docs.snippet: Did you stay up to date this week?

headline.main: News Quiz: Test Your Knowledge of the Week’s Headlines

docs.snippet: The widow of the Pulse nightclub gunman walked free on Friday after a jury cleared her of charges related to the 2016 massacre that killed 49 people in Orlando, stunning survivors who had longed to hold someone accountable.

headline.print_headline: Widow of Florida Nightclub Gunman Cleared of All Charges
headline.main: Widow of Florida Nightclub Gunman Cleared of All Charges

docs.snippet: Many Americans can buy a gun in less than an hour. In some countries, the process takes months.

headline.main: How to Buy a Gun in 15 Countries

docs.snippet: Following are five big themes likely to dominate thinking of investors and traders in the coming week and the Reuters stories related to them.

headline.print_headline: Take Five: World Markets Themes for the Week Ahead
headline.main: Take Five: World Markets Themes for the Week Ahead

docs.snippet: The United States will no longer shoulder more than a quarter of the multibillion-dollar costs of the United Nations' peacekeeping operations, Washington's envoy said Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: US: Won't Pay Over 25 Percent of UN Peacekeeping Anymore
headline.main: US: Won't Pay Over 25 Percent of UN Peacekeeping Anymore

docs.snippet: SoftBank Group Corp's Vision Fund will invest in creating the world's biggest solar power project in Saudi Arabia, it said on Tuesday, stepping up its involvement in the kingdom and expanding beyond technology.

headline.print_headline: SoftBank Vision Fund, Saudi Arabia to Create World's Biggest Solar Power Firm
headline.main: SoftBank Vision Fund, Saudi Arabia to Create World's Biggest Solar Power Firm
